title: How do I disable Y536A1 TalkBack?
answer:
TalkBack is a screen reader service on Android devices for blind and vision-impaired users. After you enable TalkBack, sliding requires two fingers, touching an item selects the item, and double-touching an item enables your phone to perform the corresponding operation. 

1.         Press the power button to turn on the screen. Slide on the screen using two fingers to unlock the screen.

2.         Use two fingers to swipe from top to bottom to open the notification panel.

3.         Touch and then double-touch ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141024001926726001.png).

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141024001928470002.png)

4.         On the **Settings** screen, touch and then double-touch **Accessibility**.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141024001928495003.png)

5.         Touch and then double-touch **TalkBack**.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141024001929370004.png)

6.         Touch and then double-touch the switch.

7.         Touch and then double-touch **OK**.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141024001929447005.png)

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141024001930516006.png)

                                       The figures are for your reference only. The actual
screens may vary.
